随着虚拟现实 (VR) 和增强现实 (AR) 技术的不断普及，虚拟化身正成为我们数字交互中越来越重要的一部分。特别是，虚拟化身是许多社交 VR 和 AR 交互的中心，因为它们是代表远程参与者和促进协作的关键。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 在过去的十年中，跨学科科学家付出了大量的努力来更好地理解化身的使用，并做出了许多有趣的观察，包括用户<a href="https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/frvir.2020.575943/full">;体现他们的化身</a>;的能力（即，认为化身身体是他们自己的错觉） ）和<a href="https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/9089510">;自我头像追随者效果</a>;，它在头像和用户的动作之间创建了足够强的绑定头像实际上可以影响用户的行为。 </p>; <p>; 在实验中使用化身不仅是为了研究用户在 VR 空间中的互动和行为方式，也是为了发现人类感知和神经科学的局限性。事实上，一些 VR 社交实验通常依赖于重新创建在现实世界中无法轻松重现的场景，例如酒吧爬行到 <a href="https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0052766" >;探索内群体与外群体效应</a>;，或欺骗实验，例如<a href="https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0209704">;米尔格拉姆对虚拟现实中权威的服从</一个>;。其他研究试图探索深层神经科学现象，例如<a href="https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/abs/10.1098/rstb.2021.0453">;人类运动控制机制</a>;。这或许遵循大脑可塑性的<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/35784">;橡胶手错觉</a>;，一个人可以开始感觉自己拥有一块橡胶手，而他们真正的手隐藏在窗帘后面。使用个性化<a href="https://doi.org/10.1186/s13063-022-06683-1">;化身</a>;进行精神治疗的可能疗法也越来越多。在这些情况下，VR 成为一种<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecological_validity">;生态上有效的</a>;工具，使科学家能够探索或治疗人类行为和感知。 </p>; <p>; 如果没有能够方便地进行实验的研究工具和库，这些实验和疗法都不可能存在。因此，近年来围绕头像创建和动画发布了多个系统和开源工具。然而，现有的头像库尚未在多样性谱上进行系统验证。与化身互动时，社会<a href="https://doi.org/10.1016/j.concog.2013.04.016">;偏见和动态</a>;也会转移到 VR/AR，这可能会导致得出不完整的结论VR/AR 中人类行为的研究。 </p>; <p>; 为了部分解决这个问题，我们与中佛罗里达大学合作创建并发布了开源<a href="https://github.com/google/valid-avatar-library" >;实现包容性和多样性的虚拟头像库</a>;（有效）。 <a href="https://doi.org/10.3389/frvir.2023.1248915">;我们最近的论文</a>;中进行了描述，发表于<a href="https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/virtual -reality">;<i>;虚拟现实前沿</i>;</a>;，该化身库可随时用于 VR/AR 实验，其中包括美国人口普查局认可的 7 个不同种族和民族的 210 个化身。这些化身经过感知验证，旨在促进虚拟化身研究的多样性和包容性。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;库的创建和验证</h2>; <p>; 我们的多样化头像库的种族和民族的初步选择遵循<a href="https://www.npr.org/2023/01/26/1151608403/mena-race-categories-us-census的最新指南-middle-eastern-latino-hispanic">;美国人口普查局</a>;建议，截至 2023 年，使用代表美国社会大部分人口的 7 个民族和种族群体，这也可以推断到全球人口。这些群体包括西班牙裔或拉丁裔、美洲印第安人或阿拉斯加原住民 (AIAN)、亚洲人、黑人或非裔美国人、夏威夷原住民或其他太平洋岛民 (NHPI)、</em>; <em>;白人、中东或北非</em>; (MENA)。我们预计图书馆将继续发展，通过未来添加的头像带来更多的多样性和代表性。 </p>; <p>; 化身是手工建模和创建的，使用的过程将平均面部特征与每个种族群体的代表利益相关者的广泛合作相结合，他们的反馈用于艺术地修改化身的面部网格。然后我们对来自 33 个国家的参与者进行了一项在线研究，以确定图书馆中每个头像的种族和性别是否可识别。除了头像之外，我们还提供通过观察用户对所有 42 个基本头像的种族和性别进行统计验证的标签（见下文）。 </p>; </tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; 我们发现所有亚洲人、黑人和白人化身都被所有参与者普遍认为是他们的模仿种族，而我们的美洲印第安人或阿拉斯加原住民（AIAN） ）、西班牙裔、中东或北非 (MENA) 化身通常只能由同一种族的参与者识别。这也表明，参与者种族可以提高对同一种族的虚拟角色的识别度。图书馆发布的论文强调了在研究 VR 中的化身行为时如何考虑这种群体内的熟悉度。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;数据集详细信息</h2>; <p>; 我们的模型采用 <a href="https://www.autodesk.com/products/fbx/overview">;FBX 格式</a>;，与以前的头像库兼容，例如常用的<a href="https://github.com/microsoft/Microsoft-Rocketbox">;Rocketbox</a>;，并且可以轻松集成到大多数游戏引擎中，例如<a href="https://unity. com/">;Unity</a>; 和 <a href="https://www.unrealengine.com/">;Unreal</a>;。此外，头像还配有 69 块骨骼和 65 种面部混合形状，使研究人员和开发人员能够轻松创建和应用动态面部表情和动画。这些头像被故意制作成部分卡通化，以避免极端相似的场景，在这种情况下，一个人可能被模仿，但仍然具有足够的代表性，能够进行可靠的用户研究和社会实验。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; “https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhFB1yk-wkwGzjxoAmN6xdTY1qut_K7Aad1WNMlW-z7O02NTE4nQL1kJheHNEbJxACsUlmu4HEmk8uXnPkeO9Jf_T3WE5qPgJZgJcbmXbf href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki /Shor%27s_algorithm">;Shor 因式分解算法</a>;和<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/10/developing-industrial-use-cases-for.html">;量子模拟</一个>;。在这几个例子中，大多数都涉及模拟本质上是量子力学的物理系统——这是量子计算机的自然应用。但是模拟本质上不是量子的系统又如何呢？量子计算机能否为此提供指数级优势？ </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 在“<a href="https://link.aps.org/doi/10.1103/PhysRevX.13.041041">;模拟中的指数量子加速耦合经典振荡器</a>;”，发表于 <a href="https://journals.aps.org/prx/">;Physical Review X</a>; (PRX) 并在<a href="https ://focs.computer.org/2023/">;计算机科学基础研讨会</a>; (FOCS 2023)，我们报告了一种新量子算法的发现，该算法为模拟耦合提供了指数级优势<a href= “https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonic_oscillator">;经典谐振子</a>;。这些是自然界中一些最基本、普遍存在的系统，可以描述无数自然系统的物理学，从电路到分子振动再到桥梁力学。我们与麦考瑞大学的 Dominic Berry 和多伦多大学的 Nathan Wiebe 合作，发现了一种映射，可以将任何涉及耦合振荡器的系统转化为描述量子系统时间演化的问题。在某些限制下，使用量子计算机解决这个问题的速度比使用经典计算机快得多。此外，我们使用这种映射来证明，任何可以通过量子算法有效解决的问题都可以重新转换为涉及耦合振荡器网络的问题，尽管耦合振荡器的数量呈指数级增长。除了解锁量子计算机以前未知的应用之外，这一结果还提供了一种通过纯粹推理经典系统来设计新量子算法的新方法。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;模拟耦合振荡器</h2>; <p>;我们考虑的系统由经典谐振子组成。单谐振子的一个例子是连接到弹簧上的质量（例如球）。如果将质量块从其静止位置移开，则弹簧将产生恢复力，沿相反方向推动或拉动质量块。该恢复力导致质量块来回振荡。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" cWE19xRL5DLh42HtY6Q-mDXrO1uIqnjQ3IATUW8IQEiztKGpRWMUTvz8YCsPoaKfNjzPPFbXia5-9jIdT0ZWd4gPYutNtPJ-b__8Xb/s359/oscillator.gif " style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" 现在考虑<em>;耦合</em>;谐波振荡器，其中<em>;多个</em>;质量通过弹簧相互连接。移动一个质量，就会引起一波振荡穿过系统。正如人们所预料的那样，在经典计算机上模拟大量质量的振荡变得越来越困难。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh-jWiEDm-tYXeXlLLq6wNXEHUuxHiNg-vwloUFyzE2GPLbekSHMrfE6Qupy4QjI3Ca6zV97hhiZei1rMb-zMXnKV6IK fNVVBX3Z2Dm8sVxDM5llRXfID3xON38bLXBhHEvlNF28xitJWdERmhHuagjYli4yMT17YTzmDkuKE-mFxJ3e9sdM-ct3lU81Gs1 /s1129/image4.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" center;">;通过弹簧连接的质量示例系统，可以使用以下命令进行模拟量子算法。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>;为了能够模拟大量耦合谐振子，我们提出了一个映射，对所有谐振子的位置和速度进行编码质量和弹簧进入量子位系统的量子波函数。由于描述量子位系统波函数的参数数量随着量子位数量呈指数增长，因此我们可以将 <em>;N</em>; 个球的信息编码到仅约 log(<em>;N </em>;）量子位。只要对系统有一个紧凑的描述（即质量和弹簧的属性），我们就可以演化波函数来稍后学习球和弹簧的坐标，并且所用的资源比我们使用时要少得多模拟球和弹簧的朴素经典方法。 </p>; <p>; 我们证明了一类耦合经典振荡器系统可以在量子计算机上有效地模拟。但仅此一点并不能排除存在某种尚不为人知的巧妙经典算法的可能性，该算法在资源使用方面同样高效。为了证明我们的量子算法比任何可能的经典算法实现指数加速，我们提供了两个额外的证据。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;粘合树问题和量子预言</h2>; <p>; 对于第一个证据，我们使用我们的映射来表明量子算法可以有效地解决一个著名的问题关于已知难以经典解决的图，称为<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/quant-ph/0209131">;粘合树问题</a>;。该问题需要两个分支树（一个图，其节点每个分支到另外两个节点，类似于树的分支路径）并通过一组随机边将它们的分支粘合在一起，如下图所示。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjoHV_EgsCy3f3fid2P29Lyq00CQtPBiV9cc2A2oL6RoX0W3oawha617NRm7a6J9fdUPG7z55MuHKnko5eDCRZ4t b6mVvFQ-twhlL3EjLKDHKHDw0-69-0ESWovOsDTbkAfDBUwRiYa0U8rfHeGOB_JwfcWIXQyJYnfmRjI5E7ygfZz-l5w1N4Kisle8WeV/s930/image2 .png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="556" data-original-width="930" src="https: //blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjoHV_EgsCy3f3fid2P29Lyq00CQtPBiV9cc2A2oL6RoX0W3oawha617NRm7a6J9fdUPG7z55MuHKnko5eDCRZ4tb6mVvFQ-twhlL3EjLKDHKHDw ENTRANCE 的节点开始，并允许本地探索该图，该图是通过将两个二叉树随机粘合在一起而获得的。目标是找到标记为 EXIT 的节点。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; 粘合树问题的目标是找到退出节点 - 的“根”第二棵树——尽可能高效。但粘合树的节点和边缘的确切配置最初对我们来说是隐藏的。要了解系统，我们必须查询<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_machine">;oracle</a>;，它可以回答有关设置的具体问题。这个神谕允许我们探索树木，但仅限于本地。几十年前，<a href="https://doi.org/10.1145/780542.780552">;研究表明</a>;在经典计算机上找到退出节点所需的查询数量与多项式因子成正比<em>;N</em>;，节点总数。 </p>; <p>; 但是将其重新转换为球和弹簧的问题，我们可以将每个节点想象为一个球，将两个节点之间的每个连接想象为一个弹簧。拨动入口节点（第一棵树的根），振荡将穿过树木。只需花费与树的<em>;深度</em>;成比例的时间（比<em>;N</em>;指数小）即可到达出口节点。因此，通过将胶合树球弹簧系统映射到量子系统并对其进行演化，我们可以检测出口节点的振动，并比使用经典计算机更快地确定它。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;BQP 完整性</h2>; <p>; 通过检查一组问题，我们揭示了我们的算法比任何可能的经典算法效率指数级更高的第二个也是最有力的证据：量子计算机可以高效求解（即可以在<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_complexity#Polynomial_time">;多项式时间</a>;内求解），简称为<a href="https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BQP">;有界误差量子多项式时间</a>;或BQP。 BQP 中最难的问题称为“BQP-complete”。 </p>; <p>; 虽然人们普遍认为存在一些量子算法可以有效解决而经典算法无法解决的问题，但这一点尚未得到证实。所以，我们能提供的最好证据是我们的问题是 BQP 完备的，也就是说，它是 BQP 中最难的问题之一。如果有人找到一种有效的经典算法来解决我们的问题，那么量子计算机有效解决的每个问题都将是经典可解决的！甚至连构成<a href= “https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(cryptosystem)">;现代加密</a>;，并由 Shor 算法著名地解决，预计将是 BQP 完整的。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgOiKMkim0vUjHjx54ZpJwWUCC4pjOcbz1xuSAvMm7ZUI_sZ7mtEjSs8VLIDXGYrxlJonUcz53RBm-4MXRD1 B0ZnDD4buC25_mmmwAmuXiWgCEKNuhJGOzpbBET4sAjZwwO8S8XxMe7e-WkcRy2YI0FiXhTmGHQ70aTTX0oW-lSVwr-jG09gsXP2qu_yWmb/s574/image1 .png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" =“https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgOiKMkim0vUjHjx54ZpJwWUCC4pjOcbz1xuSAvMm7ZUI_sZ7mtEjSs8VLIDXGYrxlJonUcz53RBm-4MXRD1B0ZnDD4buC25_mmmwAmu XiWgCEKNuhJGOzpbBEt4sAjZwwO8S8XxMe7e-WkcRy2YI0FiXhTmGHQ70aTTX0oW-lSVwr-jG09gsXP2qu_yWmb/s320/image1.png" width="320" />;</a>;</td>; </tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;显示 BQP 完备的。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;影响和未来的工作</h2>; <p>; 这项工作还揭示了 2002 年的工作，当时理论计算机科学家 Lov K. Grover 和他的同事 Anirvan M. Sengupta 使用<a href="https://journals.aps.org/pra/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevA.65.032319">;耦合摆的类比</a>;来说明 Grover 著名的量子<a href="https:// en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grover%27s_algorithm">;搜索算法</a>;可以比传统方法更快地在未排序的数据库中找到正确的元素。通过正确的设置和初始条件，在系统进化一段时间后，就有可能判断一个<em>;N</em>;摆是否与其他摆不同——类似于在数据库中找到正确的元素那只是~√(<em>;N)</em>;。虽然这暗示了某些经典振荡系统和量子算法之间的联系，但它无法解释为什么格罗弗的量子算法实现了量子优势。 </p>; <p>; 我们的结果使这种联系更加精确。我们证明，任何经典谐振子系统的动力学确实可以等价地理解为相应的指数较小的量子系统的动力学。这样我们就可以在 log(<em>;N</em>;) 个量子位的量子计算机上模拟 Grover 和 Sengupta 的钟摆系统，并找到一种不同的量子算法，可以及时找到正确的元素 ~√(<em>; N</em>;)。我们在经典系统和量子系统之间发现的类比可用于构建其他提供指数加速的量子算法，其中加速的原因现在从经典波的传播方式中更加明显。 </p>; <p>; 我们的工作还表明，每种量子算法都可以等效地理解为经典波在耦合振荡器系统中的传播。这意味着，例如，我们原则上可以构建一个经典系统，在它的演化时间比任何已知的解决因式分解的经典算法的运行时间小得多的时间之后，它可以解决因式分解问题。这可能看起来像是一种高效的经典因式分解算法，但问题是振荡器的数量呈指数级增长，这使得它成为解决因式分解的不切实际的方法。耦合谐振子在自然界中无处不在，描述了从电路到分子链再到桥梁等结构的广泛系统。虽然我们在这里的工作重点是这类广泛问题的基本复杂性，但我们希望它将指导我们寻找谐振子问题的现实示例，在这些示例中量子计算机可以提供指数优势。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;致谢</h2>; <p>; <em>;我们要感谢我们的量子计算科学传播者 Katie McCormick 帮助撰写这篇博文。</em>; </em>; </p>; p>;</content>;<link href="http://blog.research.google/feeds/3665865722098768988/comments/default" rel="replies" title="发表评论" type="application/atom+xml"/ >;<link href="http://blog.research.google/2023/12/a-new-quantum-algorithm-for-classical.html#comment-form" rel="replies" title="0 条评论" 类型="text/html"/>;<link href="http://www.blogger.com/feeds/8474926331452026626/posts/default/3665865722098768988" rel="edit" type="application/atom+xml"/>;<链接 href="http://www.blogger.com/feeds/8474926331452026626/posts/default/3665865722098768988" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml"/>;<link href="http://blog .research.google/2023/12/a-new-quantum-algorithm-for-classical.html" rel="alternate" title="一种具有指数加速的经典力学新量子算法" type="text/html" />;<author>;<name>;Google AI</name>;<uri>;http://www.blogger.com/profile/12098626514775266161</uri>;<email>;noreply@blogger.com</email>;<gd:image高度=“16” rel=“http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail” src=“https://img1.blogblog.com/img/b16-rounded.gif” 宽度=“16” >;</gd:image>;</author>;<media:thumbnail height="72" url="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhFB1yk-wkwGzjxoAmN6xdTY1qut_K7Aad1WNMlW-z7O02NTE4nQL1kJheHNEbJxACsUlmu4HEmk8uXn PkeO9Jf_T3WE5qPgJZgJcbmXbf06nTiL3MRO-ull3C6SWsxVVzIsyK-ZojzHoP1e_elh4im6LHDblGgiviZrUPlOIy92QMVIF87_j5y83WMLn49/s72 -c/glued-trees.jpg" width="72" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">;</media:thumbnail>;<thr:total>;0</thr:total >;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;标签：blogger.com,1999:blog-8474926331452026626.post-68038970217457115</id>;<已发布>;2023-12-04T10:00:00.000-08:00</已发布>; <更新>;2023-12-04T11:29:40.224-08:00</更新>;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="ads">;</category>; <类别方案=“http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#”术语=“优化”>;</类别>;<类别方案=“http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#” term="安全和隐私">;</category>;<title type="text">;Privacy Sandbox 归因报告 API 中的摘要报告优化</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author ">;发布者：Google 软件工程师 Hidayet Aksu 和研究科学家 Adam Sealfon</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiFxpfW7ZN6OUw0lsK3lruiscqMgB3Jt8aBViPGNvHA0MzUPSFp6TRDOPdqSfO4A_0Qg pWQo5mT0Vdplv5uBFQmdSePT1LPlwN-hLJ1TP-SHwmIMXYfoNL9CxBw11ABp89ril2o6lDJcT8MCJQ6HwU13vmN6CqnCnNwSpH9d4lgO_CISNxVqKCYSyT_SiwN/s320 /hero.jpg" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; 近年来，推出了<a href="https://privacysandbox.com/">;隐私沙盒</a>;计划，旨在探索广告商如何负责任地衡量其广告活动的有效性，其目标是<a href="https://blog.chromium.org/2020/01/building-more-private-web-path-towards.html">;弃用第三方 Cookie</a>;（受<a href ="https://www.gov.uk/cma-cases/investigation-into-googles-privacy-sandbox-browser-changes">;与英国竞争和市场管理局解决任何竞争问题</a>;）。 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_cookie#Third-party_cookie">;Cookie</a>; 是网站存储在用户设备上的包含用户偏好设置的小数据；它们可用于提供更好的浏览体验（例如，允许用户自动登录）并提供相关内容或广告。 Privacy Sandbox 试图通过提供隐私保护替代方案来解决有关使用 cookie 跟踪整个网络浏览数据的问题。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 许多浏览器使用<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Differential_privacy">;差分隐私</a>;（DP ）提供隐私保护 API，例如<a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/privacy-sandbox/attribution-reporting">;归因报告 API</a>; (ARA)，不依赖 cookie 来衡量广告转化。 ARA 会对个人用户操作进行加密，并将其收集到聚合的<a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/privacy-sandbox/summary-reports/">;摘要报告</a>;中，该报告会估计测量目标，例如归因于广告活动的转化（网站上的有用操作，例如购买或注册邮件列表）的数量和价值。 </p>; <p>; 配置 API 参数的任务（例如，在不同的转化之间分配贡献预算）对于最大化摘要报告的效用非​​常重要。在“<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.13586">;Privacy Sandbox 归因报告 API 中的摘要报告优化</a>;”中，我们介绍了用于对摘要报告进行建模的正式数学框架。然后，我们将最大化摘要报告效用的问题表述为优化问题，以获得最佳 ARA 参数。最后，我们使用真实和合成数据集评估该方法，并证明与基线非优化摘要报告相比，实用性显着提高。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;ARA 摘要报告</h2>; <p>; 我们使用以下示例来说明我们的符号。想象一家名为 <em>;Du & 的虚构礼品店。 Penc</em>; 使用数字广告来吸引客户。下表记录了他们的假日销售情况，其中每条记录都包含展示次数特征，其中包括 (i) 展示次数 ID、(ii) 广告活动和 (iii) 展示广告的城市，以及转化特征，包括 (i)购买的物品数量以及 (ii) 这些物品的总美元价值。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjqrhtaPxDlj8o5sbubBQLdCq_RRnT2ZPmhxuvEIC_9SvLfhKkXh1t_elS4eRCQyHv2pYX4YkAX1UkEX3c3B dbB5PejqLF0uq_MAXuXKVA1YPKVnZ5tqertr02eNDFjJ0nnoeD_rGdDFWxLrTsCNGXOE9LrGSsuPhrtZ6SgqRomWRjpun1JdrwWDfnfJF0n/s1035/image4.png" style="margin-左：自动；右边距：自动；">;<img border="0" data-original-height="397" data-original-width="1035" height="245" src="https://blogger .googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjqrhtaPxDlj8o5sbubBQLdCq_RRnT2ZPmhxuvEIC_9SvLfhKkXh1t_elS4eRCQyHv2pYX4YkAX1UkEX3c3BdbB5PejqLF0uq_MAXuXKVA1YPKVn Z5tqertr02eNDFjJ0nnoeD_rGdDFWxLrTsCNGXOE9LrGSsuPhrtZ6SgqRomWRjpun1JdrwWDfnfJF0n/w640-h245/image4.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr- Caption" style="text-align: center;">;Du & 的展示和转化功能日志Penc.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;数学模型< /h3>; <p>; ARA 摘要报告可以通过四种算法建模：(1) 贡献向量，(2) <a href="https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/blob/main/ AGGREGATE.md#contribution-bounding-and-budgeting">;贡献边界</a>;，(3) <a href="https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/blob/main/AGGREGATION_SERVICE_TEE。 md?">;摘要报告</a>;，以及 (4) 重构值。贡献边界和摘要报告由 ARA 执行，而贡献向量和重构值由 AdTech 提供商（使企业能够购买和销售数字广告的工具和系统）执行。这项工作的目的是协助广告技术公司优化摘要报告算法。 </p>; <p>; 贡献向量算法将测量结果转换为离散化和缩放的 ARA 格式。缩放需要考虑每次展示的总体贡献限制。在这里，我们提出了一种剪辑并执行随机舍入的方法。该算法的结果是可聚合键和值的直方图。 </p>; <p>; 接下来，贡献边界算法在客户端设备上运行，并对归因报告强制执行贡献边界，其中任何超出限制的进一步贡献都会被丢弃。输出是归因转化的直方图。 </p>; <p>; 摘要报告算法在<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trusted_execution_environment">;可信执行环境</a>;内的服务器端运行，并返回嘈杂的聚合结果满足DP。噪声是从离散的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laplace_distribution">;拉普拉斯分布</a>;中采样的，并且为了执行隐私预算，可以仅查询报告一次。 </p>; <p>; 最后，重建值算法将测量值转换回原始比例。重建值和贡献向量算法由 AdTech 设计，两者都会影响从摘要报告中收到的效用。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh0gUXyl66S0s9xVnnRLOOITvsG3eL9r9K53ouX_0VS7PBeXLepqo2IVasreHXMPjsMOQhf3qOfmhBITnoOvQ1_usH9rRPeK ysIXb5Zeebn5FS9vfpU2Qhst8VFHNZvdzV7spvp4Sc3fVVyH4cG3pmbipD4gz6etV2-MsbrrByChGE7WP1ua8iIDvC97LA7/s1999/image1.png"样式="左边距：自动；右边距：自动；">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1014" data-original-width="1999" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent. com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh0gUXyl66S0s9xVnnRLOOITvsG3eL9r9K53ouX_0VS7PBeXLepqo2IVasreHXMPjsMOQhf3qOfmhBITnoOvQ1_usH9rRPeKysIXb5Zeebn5FS9vfpU2Qhst8VFHNZvdz V7spvp4Sc3fVVyH4cG3pmbipD4gz6etV2-MsbrrByChGE7WP1ua8iIDvC97LA7/s16000/image1.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align : center;">;ARA 摘要报告的说明性用法，其中包括贡献向量（算法 A）、贡献边界（算法 C）、摘要报告（算法 S）和重构值（算法 R）。算法C和S在API中是固定的。 AdTech 设计了 ​​A 和 R。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; < h2>;误差度量</h2>; <p>;在选择误差度量来评估近似质量时需要考虑几个因素。为了选择特定的度量，我们考虑了误差度量的理想属性，该属性可以进一步用作目标函数。考虑到所需的属性，我们选择了<a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/privacy-sandbox/summary-reports/design-decisions/#rmsre">;𝜏-截断均方根相对误差</ a>; (RMSRE<sub>;𝜏</sub>;) 作为其属性的误差指标。有关详细讨论以及与其他可能指标的比较，请参阅<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.13586">;论文</a>;。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;优化</h2>; <p>; 根据 RMSRE 测量优化效用<sub>;𝜏</ sub>;，我们为每个切片选择一个上限参数 C 和隐私预算 𝛼。两者的组合决定了如何在 AdTech 端对实际测量（例如总价值为 3 美元的两次转化）进行编码，然后传递给 ARA 进行贡献边界算法处理。 RMSRE<sub>;𝜏</sub>; 可以精确计算，因为它可以用限幅偏差和噪声分布方差来表示。按照这些步骤，我们发现固定隐私预算 𝛼<sub>; </sub>; 或上限参数 C 的 RMSRE<sub>;𝜏</sub>; 是 <a href="https://en. wikipedia.org/wiki/Convex_optimization">;凸</a>;（因此可以有效地获得其他参数的误差最小化值），而对于联合变量（C，𝛼），它变成非凸的（因此我们可能不会始终能够选择最佳的参数）。在任何情况下，任何现成的优化器都可以用于选择隐私预算和上限参数。在我们的实验中，我们使用<a href="https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/optimize.minimize-slsqp.html">;SLSQP</a>;最小化器https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/ generated/scipy.optimize.minimize.html">;scipy.optimize</a>; 库。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;合成数据</h2>; <p>; 不同的 ARA 配置可以通过在转换数据集。然而，由于隐私问题，对此类数据的访问可能会受到限制或缓慢，或者根本不可用。解决这些限制的一种方法是使用复制真实数据特征的合成数据。 </p>; <p>; 我们提出了一种通过现实世界转换数据集的统计建模来负责任地生成合成数据的方法。我们首先对真实转换数据集进行实证分析，以揭示 ARA 的相关特征。然后，我们设计一个管道，使用这种分布知识来创建可以通过输入参数进行自定义的真实合成数据集。 </p>; <p>; 管道首先根据<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_law">;幂律分布</a>;生成展示次数（第 1 步），然后每次展示都会根据<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poisson_distribution">;泊松分布</a>;生成转化（第 2 步），最后，对于每次转化，它会生成提取的转化值来自<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Log-normal_distribution">;对数正态分布</a>;（步骤 3）。通过与数据集相关的参数，我们发现这些分布与广告数据集特征密切匹配。因此，人们可以从历史或公共数据集中学习参数并生成用于实验的合成数据集。 </p>; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="841" data-original-width="840" src=" https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhj7tcj0k-h4e2ZsEdIfG6FtkppEv0_Z_Vl4smOLgUoXKqFUSByNdDuvutA58TATLM9BmjZVugPG9TWL5VUd4fIQ_acxdIhJx-EK3qY-D8WJ i_aqTvhgNZXfqwLyXxBOSS-vIHIWHYKWa-7_kNyrqHlkWxmRlBl4LbeYdx9sonX159djwHBP41W1jNBLMEJ/s16000/image2.png"/>;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr >;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;总体数据集生成步骤以及用于说明的功能。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>; 实验评估 </h2>; <p>; 我们在三个真实数据集上评估我们的算法（<a href=" https://ailab.criteo.com/criteo-spoke-search-conversion-log-dataset/">;Criteo</a>;、AdTech Real Estate 和 AdTech Travel）和三个综合数据集。 Criteo 包含 1500 万次点击，房地产包含 10 万次转化，旅游包含 3 万次转化。每个数据集被划分为训练集和测试集。训练集用于选择贡献预算、裁剪阈值参数和转化计数限制（现实数据集每次点击只有一次转化），并在测试集上评估误差。每个数据集都使用印象特征划分为切片。对于现实世界的数据集，我们考虑每个切片的三个查询；对于合成数据集，我们考虑每个切片的两个查询。 </p>; <p>; 对于每个查询，我们选择 RMSRE<sub>;𝝉</sub>; 𝜏 值作为训练数据集查询中值的五倍。这确保了误差度量对数据重新缩放的不变性，并允许我们通过对每个特征使用 𝝉 来组合来自不同尺度特征的误差。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEi_y5lBRvm3MhfZn6vSJgY2kAQw-95oT5wVCl2Mblkv3Cn1069EBJIaNFrXddOqSk1b5YUbNZUGAmmbFYdKLIqg5 ngm5wUJXwnTcnhya3l_ovwMhgsPwJN5I6tKKJGYI4iNgEynK6ismsXKeay6UfhlVIZt8aEmLrIybPwHbkmt9L07K_s1C9rKIxwrKCpr/s1971/image5.png"样式="左边距：自动；右边距：自动；">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1028" data-original-width="1971" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent. com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEi_y5lBRvm3MhfZn6vSJgY2kAQw-95oT5wVCl2Mblkv3Cn1069EBJIaNFrXddOqSk1b5YUbNZUGAmmbFYdKLIqg5ngm5wUJXwnTcnhya3l_ovwMhgsPwJN5I 6tKKJGYI4iNgEynK6ismsXKeay6UfhlVIZt8aEmLrIybPwHbkmt9L07K_s1C9rKIxwrKCpr/s16000/image5.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align : center;">;现实世界数据集的散点图，说明观察转换值的概率。拟合曲线代表了最佳对数正态分布模型，可以有效捕获数据中的基本模式。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40 %;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;结果</h3>; <p>; 我们将基于优化的算法与简单的基线方法进行比较。对于每个查询，基线使用相等的贡献预算和训练数据的固定分位数来选择裁剪阈值。我们的算法产生的误差远低于现实世界和合成数据集的基线。我们基于优化的方法适应隐私预算和数据。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjRJcmMU1Snvx2N4hdh5iMmadldy6nLn1jXjOGCoefqSRT7auQ3u_zZsgefqfzmsyHUBEZHR6z6ZW2CkFgxrEBe0hBeY TMihk1qtHOF-qBw_WbEdq6C8x0iQy_DvXHqMrCBqH7tnmXNCPlZI29oAiTitD-RU3hH29MKlCHiLUN_3SFkXB71-fv3fU4jx-1q/s1999/image3 .png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1999" data-original-width="1730" src="https: //blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjRJcmMU1Snvx2N4hdh5iMmadldy6nLn1jXjOGCoefqSRT7auQ3u_zZsgefqfzmsyHUBEZHR6z6ZW2CkFgxrEBe0hBeYTMihk1qtHOF-qBw_WbEdq6C 8x0iQy_DvXHqMrCBqH7tnmXNCPlZI29oAiTitD-RU3hH29MKlCHiLUN_3SFkXB71-fv3fU4jx-1q/s16000/image3.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td 类="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;RMSRE<sub>;τ</sub>; 用于我们的算法和基线的隐私预算 {1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64}三个真实世界数据集和三个合成数据集。我们基于优化的方法始终比使用固定分位数作为裁剪阈值并在查询之间平均分配贡献预算的基线实现更低的错误。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;结论</h2>; <p>; 我们研究了 ARA 中摘要报告的优化，目前已部署在数百个设备上数以百万计的 Chrome 浏览器。我们提出了 ARA 缴款预算优化问题的严格表述，目的是为研究人员提供稳健的抽象，以促进实际改进。 </p>; <p>; 我们的方案利用历史数据来限制和扩展差异隐私下未来数据的贡献，非常通用，适用于广告以外的设置。基于这项工作的一种方法是使用过去的数据来学习数据分布的参数，然后应用从该分布导出的合成数据来为未来数据的查询进行隐私预算。请参阅<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.13586">;论文</a>;和<a href="https://github.com/google-research/google-research/tree/ master/ara_optimization">;附带代码</a>;，了解详细的算法和证明。 </p>; </类别>;<类别方案=“http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#”术语=“语音”>;</类别>;<类别方案=“http://www.blogger.com/atom” /ns#" term="Translate">;</category>;<title type="text">;单语言数据的无监督语音到语音翻译</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline -author">;发布者：Google 研究部科学家 Eliya Nachmani 和软件工程师 Michelle Tadmor Ramanovich</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiuXgYf5aJuSobrasrRUpb5IUKH05RFHJ5_vcwW-XyOLQdKOEonciXcyXtcJ N2zPkHu5_k4wvIsl6oFZd4UfYsBfjSK27YaIcw7s1 -3dekdJVxTBM-4hrBvndT-go6YOsscswtV6FvE_3QHml8zZjWIz7J4quRh8UBL9gzW9guAVYd4czuHYhY6lu9TkK4K/s1600/T3.png" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; 语音转语音翻译 (S2ST) 是一种<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machine_translation">;机器翻译</a>;，它将口语从一种语言转换为一种语言。语言到另一种语言。这项技术有潜力打破语言障碍，促进不同文化和背景的人们之间的沟通。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 之前，我们介绍了<a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2019/05/introducing-translatotron-end-to- end.html">;翻译机 1</a>; 和 <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2021/09/high-quality-robust-and-responsible.html">;翻译机 2</a>; ，第一个能够直接在两种语言之间翻译语音的模型。然而，他们是在监督环境中使用并行语音数据进行训练的。并行语音数据的稀缺是该领域的一个主要挑战，以至于大多数公共数据集都是从文本半或完全合成的。这给学习翻译和重建语音属性增加了额外的障碍，这些属性没有在文本中表示，因此没有反映在合成的训练数据中。 </p>; <p>; 在这里，我们展示了 <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2305.17547">;Translatotron 3</a>;，一种新颖的无监督语音到语音翻译架构。在 Translatotron 3 中，我们证明可以仅从单语言数据学习语音到语音翻译任务。这种方法不仅为更多语言对之间的翻译打开了大门，而且还为非文本语音属性（例如停顿、语速和说话者身份）的翻译打开了大门。我们的方法不包括对目标语言的任何直接监督，因此我们认为这是在翻译过程中保留源语音的副语言特征（例如语气、情感）的正确方向。为了实现语音到语音的翻译，我们使用<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.06709">;反向翻译</a>;，这是一种来自无监督机器翻译 (UMT) 的技术，其中源语言的合成翻译用于<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.11041">;翻译没有双语文本数据集的文本</a>;。西班牙语和英语之间的语音到语音翻译任务的实验结果表明，Translatotron 3 的性能优于基线级联系统。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Translatotron 3 </h2>; <p>; Translatotron 3 解决了无监督 S2ST 的问题，可以消除双语语音数据集的要求。为此，Translatotron 3 的设计包含三个关键方面：</p>; <ol>; <li>;将整个模型预训练为 <a href="https://openaccess.thecvf.com/content/CVPR2022/html /He_Masked_Autoencoders_Are_Scalable_Vision_Learners_CVPR_2022_paper.html">;带有 <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1904.08779">;SpecAugment</a>; 的掩码自动编码器</a>;，这是一种用于语音识别的简单数据增强方法，在对数上运行输入音频（而不是原始音频本身）的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mel-Frequency_cepstrum">;梅尔频谱图</a>;，并被证明可以有效提高编码器。 </li>;<li>;基于<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.04087">;多语言无监督嵌入</a>;（MUSE）的无监督嵌入映射，它在不配对的语言上进行训练，但允许模型来学习源语言和目标语言之间共享的嵌入空间。 </li>;<li>;基于反向翻译的重建损失，以完全无监督的方式训练编码器-解码器直接 S2ST 模型。 </li>; </ol>; <p>; 该模型使用无监督 MUSE 嵌入损失、重建损失和 S2S 反向翻译损失的组合进行训练。在推理过程中，共享编码器用于将输入编码到多语言嵌入空间中，随后由目标语言解码器进行解码。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;架构</h3>; <p>; Translatotron 3 采用共享编码器对源和目标进行编码语言。解码器由语言解码器、声学合成器（负责翻译语音的声学生成）和单一注意模块组成，如 Translatotron 2。但是，对于 Translatotron 3 有两个解码器，一个用于源语言，另一个用于源语言为目标语言。在训练过程中，我们使用单语语音文本数据集（即，这些数据由语音文本对组成；它们不是翻译）。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;编码器</h3>; <p>; 编码器与 Translatotron 中的语音编码器具有相同的架构2. 编码器的输出分为两部分：第一部分包含语义信息，第二部分包含声学信息。通过使用 MUSE 损失，输出的前半部分被训练为输入语音频谱图文本的 MUSE 嵌入。后半部分更新后没有MUSE损失。值得注意的是，源语言和目标语言之间共享相同的编码器。此外，MUSE 嵌入本质上是多语言的。因此，编码器能够学习跨源语言和目标语言的多语言嵌入空间。这允许对输入进行更高效和有效的编码，因为编码器能够将两种语言的语音编码到公共嵌入空间中，而不是为每种语言维护单独的嵌入空间。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;解码器</h3>; <p>; 与 Translatotron 2 一样，解码器由三个不同的组件组成：即语言解码器、声学合成器和注意力模块。然而，为了有效处理源语言和目标语言的不同属性，Translatotron 3 针对源语言和目标语言配备了两个独立的解码器。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;两部分训练</h3>; <p>; 训练方法由两部分组成：(1)带重建的自动编码和（2）反向翻译项。在第一部分中，网络被训练为使用 MUSE 损失和重建损失将输入自动编码到多语言嵌入空间。此阶段的目的是确保网络生成有意义的多语言表示。在第二部分中，网络被进一步训练以利用反向翻译损失来翻译输入频谱图。缓解 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catastropic_interference#:~:text=Catastropic%20interference%2C%20also%20known%20as,information%20upon%20learning%20new%20information 的问题.">;灾难性遗忘</a>;和强制潜在空间为多语言、MUSE 损失和重建损失也应用于训练的第二部分。为了确保编码器学习输入的有意义的属性，而不是简单地重建输入，我们在两个阶段将 SpecAugment 应用于编码器输入。事实证明，它可以通过增加输入数据来有效提高编码器的泛化能力。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;训练目标</h3>; <p>; 在反向翻译训练阶段（如章节所示）如下），网络经过训练将输入频谱图翻译为目标语言，然后再翻译回源语言。反向翻译的目标是强制潜在空间是多语言的。为了实现这一目标，应用了以下损失： </p>; <ul>; <li>;MUSE 损失：MUSE 损失衡量输入频谱图的多语言嵌入与反向翻译频谱图的多语言嵌入之间的相似性。 </li>;<li>;重建损失：重建损失衡量输入频谱图和反向翻译频谱图之间的相似性。 </li>; </ul>; <p>; 除了这些损耗之外，SpecAugment 还应用于两个阶段的编码器输入。在反翻译训练阶段之前，网络被训练为使用 MUSE 损失和重建损失将输入自动编码到多语言嵌入空间。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;MUSE 损失</h3>; <p>; 确保编码器生成有意义的多语言表示对于这两个解码器，我们在训练期间都采用了 MUSE 损失。 MUSE 损失迫使编码器通过使用预先训练的 MUSE 嵌入来生成这样的表示。在训练过程中，给定输入文本转录本，我们从输入语言的嵌入中提取相应的 MUSE 嵌入。然后将Muse嵌入与编码器的输出向量之间的错误最小化。请注意，由于嵌入的多语言性质，编码器对推断期间输入的语言无关紧要。 </p>; <content type =“ html”>; <span class =“ byline-author”>;由Tapio Schneider，访问者的研究人员和Yi-Fan Chen发表，工程领导，Google Research</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEipIpAUM7d1E-XNQdqZ3hiRC7VgksSfuI249KFq9yL5ZTZF8-DJ5Sfo-fRf2m7hTKuTeJwSGQzwz6rtfdZs8PxlualXz7U53miz6ahU3oyO9WQWkePA1fgr5mxRa75NYKKPe0KLOYSPLxzfDfoIABePqL1etrqaDuRPjJotAVEIbuBRw6EWrJSxXB-BzCTS/s320/hero.gif" style="display: none;" />; <p>;今天的气候模型成功捕捉了广泛的全球变暖趋势。但是，由于对<a href="https://physicstoday.scitation.org/doi/abs/10.1063/pt.3.47772">;规模较小但全球重要</a>;，例如<a href =“ http://rdcu.be/ohot”>;云对即将到来的气候变化的预测并非非常准确。例如，相对于工业化前时代的全局平均地面平均地面温度的预测，<a href =“ https://www.ipcc.ch/report/ar6/wg1/downloads/ <a href =”报告/ipcc_ar6_wgi_ts.pdf“>;在当今的模型中变化40-50年</a>;（完整的人类一代）。结果，我们没有<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41558-020-00984-6">;准确且地理上的颗粒状预测</a>;我们需要计划弹性基础设施，适应供应链来应对气候破坏，并评估与气候有关的危害脆弱社区的风险。 </p>; <a name ='more'>; </a>; <p>;在很大程度上是因为云在未来几十年的气候预测中占主导地位和不确定性[<a href =“ https://doi.org /10.1029/2005GL023851">; 1 </a>;，<a href="https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00382-013-013-1725-9">; 2 </a>; 2 </a>; “ https://doi.org/10.1038/nclimate3402">; 3 </a>;]。云层反映阳光并发挥<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/greenhouse_effect">;温室效应</a>;，使其对于调节地球的能量平衡和调解气候系统对气候系统对气候系统的响应至关重要温室气体浓度的变化。但是，它们的规模太小，无法在当今的气候模型中直接解析。当前的气候模型在数十亿公里处解决了一百公里，<a href="https://link.springer.com/article/10.1186/s40645-019-019-019-0304-z">;很少有人向</a推向</a >; <a href="https://journals.ametsoc.org/view/journals/bams/101/5/bams-d-18-0167.1.xml">; kilmor-scale </a>;。但是，例如，维持的湍流空气运动，例如，覆盖大量热带海洋的低云层具有数十米的米尺度。由于规模差异很大，气候模型使用云的经验参数化，而不是直接模拟它们，从而导致较大的错误和不确定性。 </p>; <p>;虽然无法在全球气候模型中直接解决云，但可以通过使用高分辨率<a href =“ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/large_eddy_simulution在有限区域中模拟其湍流动力学“>;大型涡模拟</a>;（LES）。但是，用LES模拟云的高计算成本抑制了广泛而系统的数值实验，并且它阻止了用于训练参数化方案的大型数据集的生成，以代表粗分辨率的全球气候模型中的云。 </p>; <p>;在“ <a href="https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/fuii/10.1029/2023ms003619">; casgeReranting大型模拟云的大型模拟具有张量处理单位</a>; </a>; ”，发表于<em>; <a href="https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/journal/19422466">;建模地球系统的进步杂志</a>; </em>;（詹姆斯），以及在与<a href="https://clima.caltech.edu/">;气候建模联盟</a>;（Clima）负责人是Google的访问者，我们证明<a href =“ https：/https：/ /cloud.google.com/tpu">; tensor处理单元</a>;（TPU） - 最初用于机器学习（ML）应用程序的应用程序特定的集成电路 - 可有效地用于执行云的LES。我们表明，TPU与量身定制的软件实现结合使用，可用于模拟特别挑战性<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/marine_stratocumulus">;海洋层状clubs </a>;在这种情况下</a>;在<a href="https://doi.org/10.1175/mwr2930.1">;海洋层状果皮动力学</a>;（DYCOMS）现场研究中观察到。这种成功的基于TPU的LES代码揭示了TPU的实用性，其大量的计算资源和紧密的互连用于云模拟。 </p>; <p>;临界指标的气候模型准确性，例如降水量或大气顶部的能量平衡，在过去20年中，每十年大约提高了大约10％。我们的目标是使这项研究能够通过改善其云代表性来减少气候模型错误的50％。 </p>; <div style =“线路高：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </>;云层覆盖了约20％的热带海洋，是地球上最普遍的云类型。当前的气候模型尚无法正确重现层状云行为，这是这些模型中最大的错误来源之一。我们的工作将为大规模气候模型提供更准确的地面真相。 </p>; <p>;我们对TPU上的云的模拟表现出前所未有的计算吞吐量和缩放，例如，可以模拟跨层次云，以10×速度跨度的速度进行实时演变，跨过大约35×54 km << sup>; 2 </sup>;。此类域大小接近典型的全球气候模型网格盒的横截面区域。我们的结果为计算实验开辟了新的途径，并实质上扩大了可用于训练全球气候模型云参数化的LE样本。</p>; <table align =“中心” cellpadding =“ 8” cellSpacing =“ 4” 4“” style="margin-left: auto; <p>;两年前，我们<a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2021/05/project-guideline-enabling-enabling-those-with.html">;已宣布的项目指南</a>; Google Research与<a href="https://www.guidingeyes.org/">;指导盲人的眼睛</a>;使视觉障碍的人（例如，盲目和低视觉）步行，慢跑，和独立运行。 Project Guide Leverages On Demenlage机器学习（ML）仅使用Google Pixel手机和耳机，以沿着标有彩绘线路标记的户外路径浏览用户。该技术已经<a href="https://projectguidelinejp.withgoogle.com/intl/en/">;在世界各地测试</a>;，甚至在<a a href =“ https：// www中都进行了演示。 youtube.com/live/2cw1-plwqeq?si=mtix2ujkywulluht&； t = 7334">;在东京2020年残奥会上举行仪式</a>;。 </p>; <a name ='more'>; </a>; <p>;自从原始公告以来，我们着手通过嵌入新功能（例如障碍物检测和高级路径计划）来改进项目指南，以安全可靠地导航用户通过更复杂的场景（例如急转弯和附近的行人）。早期版本具有一个简单的逐帧图像分割，该图像分割了，该图像相对于图像框架检测到路径线的位置。这足以将用户定向到生产线，但提供了有关周围环境的有限信息。改善导航信号，例如障碍物和即将到来的转弯的警报，需要更好地理解和映射用户的环境。为了解决这些挑战，我们建立了一个平台，该平台可用于可访问性空间及其他地区的各种空间意识的应用程序。 </p>; <p>;今天，我们宣布<a href="https://github.com/google-research/project-guideline">;项目指南的开源发布</a>;，使任何人都可以使用用于改进和建立新的可访问性体验。该版本包括<a href="https://github.com/google-research/project-guideline">;源代码</a>;对于核心平台，<a a href =“ https://github.com/ Google-Research/project-guideline/tree/main/project_guideline/android“>; android应用程序</a>;，预训练<a href =” main/project_guideline/vision/Model框架</a>;。 </p>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </div>; <h2>;系统设计</h2>; <p>;主要用例是Android应用程序，但是我们希望能够以可重复的方式在各种环境中运行，测试和调试核心逻辑。这导致我们使用C ++设计和构建系统，以与<a href="https://develovelers.google.com/mediapipe">; MediaPipe </a>;和其他核心库，同时仍然能够与使用<a href="https://developer.android.com/ndk">; android ndk </a>;使用Android。 </p>; <p>;在引擎盖下，项目指南使用<a href="https://developers.google.com/ar">; arcore </a>; </a>;估计用户导航时的位置和方向课程。基于<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.02611">; deeplabv3+</a>;框架的细分模型=“ https://ai.googleblog.com/2021/05/project-guideline-enabling-those-with.html”>;以前的博客文章</a>;以获取更多详细信息）。然后，使用Arcore提供的相机姿势和镜头参数（内在），将分段指南上的点从图像空间坐标投影到世界空间接地平面上。由于每个帧对线路有不同的看法，因此在多个帧上汇总了世界空间点，以构建现实世界指南的虚拟映射。该系统执行指南世界空间坐标的分段曲线近似，以构建时空一致的轨迹。这允许随着用户沿路径的进展而对估计线进行改进。 </p>; red </strong>;）以构建状态表示（<strong>; blue </strong>;）随着跑步者沿路径的进展。</td>; </tr>; </tbody>; </table>; <p>;控制系统动态地选择了基于用户的当前位置，速度，和方向。然后将音频反馈信号发送给用户，以调整其标题与即将到来的线段一致。通过使用跑步者的速度向量而不是相机方向来计算导航信号，我们消除了运行过程中常见的不规则摄像机运动引起的噪声。我们甚至可以在用户不在相机视图的情况下将用户导航回生产线，例如，如果用户超越了转弯。这是可能的，因为Arcore继续跟踪相机的姿势，可以将其与从以前的相机图像中推论的状态线图进行比较。 </p>; <p>;项目指南还包括障碍检测和回避功能。 ML模型用于估算单个图像的深度。要训​​练这种单眼深度模型，我们使用<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/10/sanpo-scene-scene-understanding-accesselibility.html">; sanpo </a>;来自内部策划的Urban，Park和郊区环境的图像。该模型能够检测各种障碍的深度，包括人，车辆，哨所等。深度图被转换为3D点云，类似于线段分割过程，并用于检测沿用户路径的障碍物的存在，然后通过音频信号提醒用户。 </p>; <p>; <a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/principles/">; Google的AI原则</a>;的第一个是“对社会有益”。作为AI从业人员，我们受到了人工智能技术对社会和我们共享环境的影响的启发，以此作为以前无法​​实现的范围。来自<a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/google-ai-climate-change-solutions/">;帮助解决气候危机</a>; /blog.google/technology/health/how-were-using-using-usion-to-to-help-transform-healthcare/">; helping transform transform healthcare </a>;，<a href =“ https://blog.google/outreach - 促进/可访问性/全球 - 访问性 - 意识-Day-google-google-google-google-google-google-google-'>;使数字世界更容易获得</a>;，我们的目标是负责任地应用AI以对全球更多人有帮助。实现全球规模要求研究人员和社区在整个AI生态系统中共同思考并采取行动。 </p>; <a name='more'>; </a>; <p>;我们称这种方式以社会为中心的AI。它既是<a href="https://hcil.umd.edu/human-centered-ai/">;人为centered ai的扩展，也是人为</a>;专注于社会总体需求的人类</a>;仍然受到个人用户的需求，特别是在更大，共享的人类经验的背景下。最近的AI进步提供了前所未有的社会水平能力，现在我们可以有条不紊地满足这些需求 - 如果我们将集体的，多学科的AI研究应用于社会级别，共同的挑战，从预测饥饿到预测疾病到提高生产力。 </p>; <p>; <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-publish-prod/documents/ai_opportunity_agenda.pdf">; ai </a>;有利于社会的机会增加天。我们在这些领域以及我们支持的研究项目中审视了我们的工作。最近，Google <a href="https://research.google/outreach/outreach/air-program/recipients/">;宣布，选择了70个教授</a>; </a>; <a href =“ https://research.google /宣传/空中策略/“>; 2023包容性研究计划奖” </a>;，该计划支持在全球历史上边缘化群体的需求方面的学术研究。通过评估这项工作，我们确定了以社会为中心的AI的一些新兴实践：</p>; <ul>; <li>; <strong>;了解社会的需求</strong>; <br/>;听取社区和伙伴的要求对深入了解主要问题，并确定要解决的优先挑战。作为一种新兴的通用技术，人工智能有可能解决可能影响人们生活的重大全球社会问题（例如，教育工人，改善医疗保健并提高生产率）。我们发现影响的关键是要以社会的需求为中心。为此，我们将努力集中在社会已经同意的目标上，例如联合国'<a href="https://globalgoals.withgoogle.com/globalgoals/globalgoals/globalgoals">; 17 17可持续发展的发展目标</a>; ，由190多个国家共同制定的一系列相互联系的目标，以应对全球挑战。 </li>; <li>; <strong>;集体努力以满足这些需求<br />; </>;开发和部署AI技术以满足社会需求时，对AI技术的开发，实施和评估。 </li>; <li>; <strong>;通过努力满足社会需求的如何衡量成功<br />; </strong>;衡量AI解决方案如何满足社会需求是很重要的。在每种情况下，我们确定了通过与利益相关者的合作进行了优化的主要和次要影响指标。 </li>; </ul>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </div>; <h2>;为什么以社会为中心的AI很重要？</h2>; <p>;下面描述的示例显示了以社会为中心的AI方法导致跨主题的影响，例如可及性，健康和气候。 </p>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </div>; 2019 </a>;，Google Research启动<a href =“ https：//blog.search。 Google/2019/08/Project-Euphonias-Personalized-Speech.html“>; Project Euphonia </a>;，一种允许具有非标准语音的个体用户来培训个性化语音识别模型的方法。我们的成功始于我们对现在能够在其移动设备上使用语音说法的每个人的影响。 </p>; <p>; Euphonia以社会为中心的AI方法开始，包括与非营利组织的集体努力<a href="http://als.net/">; ALS治疗研究所</a>; <a href="http://www.alsri.org/">; ALS Residence Initiative </a>;了解<a href =的个人的需求>;肌营养性的侧性硬化症</a>;（ALS）及其使用自动语音识别系统的能力。后来，我们开发了<a href="https://blog.research.google/2021/09/personalized-asr-models-models-from-large-and.html">;世界上最大的非标准级的世界最大的语料库</a>;语音记录，这使我们能够训练<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/03/universal-speech-model-usm-state-model-usm-state-oft-art.html">;通用语音模型</ a>; to <a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/06/responsible-ai-ai-at--google-google-research-ai.html">;更好地识别出37％的言论37％</a>;对话<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/word_error_rate">;单词错误率</a>;（wer）测量。这也导致了<a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/accessibility/speech-accessibility-project/">; 2022 </a>; ，Meta，Microsoft和Amazon开始开始<a href="https://speechaccessibilityproject.beckman.illinois.edu/">;语音可访问性项目</a>;，一项持续的计划，旨在创建公开可用的语音示例数据集改善产品并使语音识别更加包含多种语音模式。其他使用AI帮助消除方式和语言障碍的技术，包括<a href="https://about.google/stories/making-conversation-more-conversation-more-accessible-with-live-transcribe/">;实时转录</ a>;，<a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/accessibilities/first time-i-was-able-call-call-my-23岁儿童/">; live字幕</ a>; and <a href="https://blog.google/intl/en-in-in-in/products/explore-communicate/easier-access-to-web-pages-pages-let/">;大声读</a>;。 </p>; <div style =“线路高：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </div>; <h3>;专注于社会健康需求</h3>; 1在26名儿童中，在五岁之前就死了</a>;。在印度农村地区，关于与怀孕和婴儿有关的关键健康问题的准和新母亲的教育需要可扩展的低成本技术解决方案。与<a href="https://armman.org/">; armman </a>;，Google Research支持<a href =“ https://blog.research.google/2022/2022/202/08/ using-ml-to -boost-engagement-with.html“>;一个程序</a>;使用移动消息传递和机器学习（ML）算法来预测妇女何时可能会从接受干预措施（即，有针对性的预防性护理信息）中受益并鼓励他们参与其中<a href="https://armman.org/mmitra/">; mmitra </a>;免费语音通话程序。在一年之内，MMITRA计划显示出出生体重增加了三倍，女性增加了36％的婴儿，了解怀孕期间服用铁片的重要性。通过这种自动化解决方案，已经达到了超过17.5万个母亲和成长，公共卫生工作者用来提高信息传递质量。 </p>; <p>;由于社区之间的密切集体伙伴关系和建立AI技术的人之间的密切集体伙伴关系，这些努力已经成功地改善了健康。我们通过与护理人员的合作采用了同样的方法来满足各种医疗需求。一些示例包括：使用<a href="https://health.google/caregivers/arda/">;自动化视网膜疾病评估</a>;（arda）与<a href =“ https：//博客。 Google/Technology/Health/5-Myths-Abot-Medical-Ai-Debunked/“>;帮助筛查全球诊所的25万名糖尿病性视网膜病患者</a>;；我们与<a href="https://www.icadmed.com/">; icad </a>; <a href="https://www.icadmed </a>;带来我们的<a href =” - 筛查/“>;乳房X线摄影</a>; AI模型以帮助乳腺癌检测；以及<a href="https://sites.research.google/med-palm/">; med-palm 2 </a>;的开发//cloud.google.com/blog/topics/healthcare-life-sciences/sharing-google-med-palm-palm-2-medical-lange-lange-lange-lange-model">;通过云伴侣进行测试</a>;帮助医生提供更好的医生提供更好的服务病人护理。 </p>; <div style =“线路高：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </div>; <h3>;持续努力对危机响应的持续努力</h3>; <p>; Google Research Research的洪水预测努力开始in 2018 with <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-keep-people-safe-ai-enabled-flood-forecasting/">;flood forecasting</a>; in India and < a href="https://www.undp.org/bangladesh/blog/climate-change-google-and-bangladesh-floods">;expanded to Bangladesh</a>; to help combat the catastrophic damage from yearly floods. The initial efforts began with partnerships with <a href="https://cwc.gov.in/">;India's Central Water Commission</a>;, local governments and communities. The implementation of these efforts used <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-people-crisis/">;SOS Alerts</a>; on Search and Maps, and, more recently, broadly expanded access via <a href="https://sites.research.google/floods/l/0/0/3">;Flood Hub</a>;. Continued <a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/04/directing-ml-toward-natural-hazard.html">;collaborations</a>; and advancing an AI-based global flood forecasting model allowed us to <a href="https://blog.google/technology/ai/expanding-our-ml-based-flood-forecasting/">;expand this capability</a>; to <a href="https://blog .google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/flood-hub-ai-flood-forecasting-more-countries/">;over 80 countries</a>; across Africa, the Asia-Pacific region, Europe, and South, Central, and North美国。 We also partnered with networks of community volunteers to further amplify flood alerts. By working with governments and communities to measure the impact of these efforts on society, we refined our approach and algorithms each year. </p>; <p>; We were able to leverage those methodologies and some of the underlying technology, such as <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-people-crisis/">;SOS Alerts</a>;, from <a href="https://sites.research.google/floodforecasting/">;flood forecasting</a>; to similar societal needs, such as <a href="https://blog.google/products/search/mapping-wildfires-with-satellite-data/">;wildfire forecasting</a>; and <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/extreme-heat-support/">;heat alerts</a>;. Our continued engagements with organizations led to the <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/early-warning-system-wmo-google/">;support of additional efforts</a>;, such as the World Meteorological Organization's (WMO) <a href="https://public.wmo.int/en/earlywarningsforall">;Early Warnings For All Initiative</a>;. The continued engagement with communities has allowed us to learn about our users' needs on a societal level over time, expand our efforts, and compound the societal reach and impact of our efforts. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Further supporting Society-Centered AI research</h2>; <p>; <a href="https://research.google/outreach/air-program/recipients/">;We recently funded</a>; 18 university research proposals exemplifying a Society-Centered AI approach, a new track within the <a href="https://research.google/outreach/air-program/">;Google Award for Inclusion Research Program</a>;. These researchers are taking the Society-Centered AI methodology and helping create beneficial applications across the world. Examples of some of the projects funded include: </p>; <ul>; <li>;<strong>;AI-Driven Monitoring of Attitude Polarization in Conflict-Affected Countries for Inclusive Peace Process and Women's Empowerment:</strong>; This project's goal is to create LLM-powered tools that can be used to monitor peace in online conversations in developing nations. The initial target communities are where peace is in flux and the effort will put a particular emphasis on mitigating polarization that impacts women and promoting harmony.</li>; <li>;<strong>;AI-Assisted Distributed Collaborative Indoor Pollution Meters: A Case Study , Requirement Analysis, and Low-Cost Healthy Home Solution for Indian Communities: </strong>;This project is looking at the usage of low-cost pollution monitors combined with AI-assisted methodology for identifying recommendations for communities to improve air quality and at home健康。 The initial target communities are highly impacted by pollution, and the joint work with them includes the goal of developing how to measure improvement in outcomes in the local community. </li>; <li>;<strong>;Collaborative Development of AI Solutions for Scaling Up Adolescent Access to Sexual and Reproductive Health Education and Services in Uganda: </strong>;This project's goal is to create LLM-powered tools to provide personalized coaching and learning for users' needs on topics of sexual and reproductive health education in low-income settings in Sub-Saharan Africa. The local societal need is significant, with an estimated <a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9652643/">;25% rate of teenage pregnancy</a>;, and the project aims to address the needs with a collective development process for the AI solution.<strong>; </strong>; </li>; </ul>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Future direction</h2>; <p>; Focusing on society's needs, working via multidisciplinary collective research, and measuring the impact on society helps lead to AI solutions that are relevant, long-lasting, empowering, and beneficial. See the <a href="https://globalgoals.withgoogle.com/globalgoals/">;AI for the Global Goals</a>; to learn more about potential Society-Centered AI research problems. <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/google-org/httpsbloggoogleoutreach-initiativesgoogle-orgunited-nations-global-goals-google-ai-/">;Our efforts</a>; with non-profits in these areas is complementary to the research that we are doing and encouraging. We believe that further initiatives using Society-Centered AI will help the collective research community solve problems and positively impact society at large. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Generative AI">;</category>;<category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="RAI-HCT Highlights">;</category>;<title type="text">;Responsible AI at Google Research: Adversarial testing for generative AI safety</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;Posted by Kathy Meier-Hellstern, Building Responsible AI & Data Systems, Director, Google Research</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEghkgEei5l04Gs6hz4cLk9IqdDbXcx-41xZsRsJ-b2WHLDng1eZzJqo9eAwBZjZHc5P2akAKxT6vQLbn0-5nxy_OuPA5QIyWAV9Yy_4iIGch-zM2W-88Y-6e8HxkbG39hemnzheAx5GUvkMspUCaQiqE5RtxYvFKj-bI0pKzOhFVrWmSOgHJisYHBDfGdCl/s1200/lockup_GoogleResearch_FullColor_Hero.jpg" style="display: none;" />; <p>; The<em>; </em>;<a href="https://research.google/teams/responsible-ai/">;Responsible AI and Human-Centered Technology</a>; (RAI-HCT) team within Google Research is committed to advancing the theory and practice of responsible human-centered AI through a lens of culturally-aware research, to meet the needs of billions of users today, and blaze the path forward for a better AI future. The BRAIDS (Building Responsible AI Data and Solutions) team within RAI-HCT aims to simplify the adoption of RAI practices through the utilization of scalable tools, high-quality data, streamlined processes, and novel research with a current emphasis on addressing the unique challenges posed by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_artificial_intelligence">;generative AI</a>; (GenAI). </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; GenAI models have enabled unprecedented capabilities leading to a rapid surge of innovative applications. Google actively leverages <a href="https://ai.google/discover/foundation-models/">;GenAI</a>; to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/generative-ai/code/code-models-overview">;enhance</a>; its <a href="https://workspace.google.com/blog/product-announcements/duet-ai-in-workspace-now-available">;products' utility</a>; and to improve lives. While enormously beneficial, GenAI also presents risks for disinformation, bias, and security. In 2018, Google pioneered the <a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/principles/">;AI Principles</a>;, emphasizing beneficial use and prevention of harm. Since then, Google has focused on effectively implementing our principles in <a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/responsible-ai-practices/">;Responsible AI practices</a>; through 1) a comprehensive risk assessment framework, 2) internal governance structures, 3) education, empowering Googlers to integrate AI Principles into their work, and 4) the development of processes and tools that identify, measure, and analyze ethical risks throughout the lifecycle of AI-powered products. The BRAIDS team focuses on the last area, creating tools and techniques for identification of ethical and safety risks in GenAI products that enable teams within Google to apply appropriate mitigations. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;What makes GenAI challenging to build responsibly?</h2>; <p>; The unprecedented capabilities of GenAI models have been accompanied by a new spectrum of potential failures, underscoring the urgency for a comprehensive and systematic RAI approach to understanding and mitigating potential safety concerns before the model is made broadly available. One key technique used to understand potential risks is <em>;adversarial testing</em>;, which is testing performed to systematically evaluate the models to learn how they behave when provided with malicious or inadvertently harmful inputs across a range of scenarios. To that end, our research has focused on three directions: </p>; <ol>; <li>;<em>;Scaled adversarial data generation</em>;<br />; Given the diverse user communities, use cases, and behaviors, it is difficult to comprehensively identify critical safety issues prior to launching a product or service. Scaled adversarial data generation with humans-in-the-loop addresses this need by creating test sets that contain a wide range of diverse and potentially unsafe model inputs that stress the model capabilities under adverse circumstances. Our unique focus in BRAIDS lies in identifying societal harms to the diverse user communities impacted by our models. </li>; <li>;<em>;Automated test set evaluation and community engagement</em>;<br />; Scaling the testing process so that many thousands of model responses can be quickly evaluated to learn how the model responds across a wide range of potentially harmful scenarios is aided with automated test set evaluation. Beyond testing with adversarial test sets, community engagement is a key component of our approach to identify “unknown unknowns” and to seed the data generation process.</li>; <li>;<em>;Rater diversity</em>;<br />; Safety evaluations rely on human judgment, which is shaped by community and culture and is not easily automated. To address this, we prioritize research on rater diversity.</li>; </ol>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Scaled adversarial data generation</h2>; <p>; High-quality, comprehensive data underpins many key programs across Google. Initially reliant on manual data generation, we've made significant strides to automate the adversarial data generation process. A centralized data repository with use-case and policy-aligned prompts is available to jump-start the generation of new adversarial tests. We have also developed multiple synthetic data generation tools based on large language models (LLMs) that prioritize the generation of data sets that reflect diverse societal contexts and that integrate data quality metrics for improved dataset quality and diversity. </p>; <p>; Our data quality metrics include: </p>; <ul>; <li>;Analysis of language styles, including query length, query similarity, and diversity of language styles.</li>; <li>;Measurement across a wide range of societal and multicultural dimensions, leveraging datasets such as <a href="https://github.com/google-research-datasets/seegull/tree/main">;SeeGULL</a>;, <a href="https://github.com/google-research-datasets/SPICE/tree/main">;SPICE</a>;, the <a href="https://medium.com/jigsaw/scaling-machine-learning-fairness-with-societal-context-be73d4ad38e2">;Societal Context Repository</a>;.</li>; <li>;Measurement of alignment with Google's <a href="https://policies.google.com/terms/generative-ai/use-policy">;generative AI policies</a>; and intended use cases.</li>; <li>;Analysis of adversariality to ensure that we examine both explicit (the input is clearly designed to produce an unsafe output) and implicit (where the input is innocuous but the output is harmful) queries. </li>; </ul>; <p>; One of our approaches to scaled data generation is exemplified in our paper on <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.08592">;AI-Assisted Red Teaming</a>; (AART). AART generates evaluation datasets with high diversity (eg, sensitive and harmful concepts specific to a wide range of cultural and geographic regions), steered by AI-assisted recipes to define, scope and prioritize diversity within an application context. Compared to some state-of-the-art tools, AART shows promising results in terms of concept coverage and data quality. Separately, we are also working with MLCommons to contribute to <a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/10/supporting-benchmarks-for-ai-safety.html">;public benchmarks for AI Safety</一个>;。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Adversarial testing and community insights </h2>; <p>; Evaluating model output with adversarial test sets allows us to identify critical safety issues prior to deployment. Our initial evaluations relied exclusively on human ratings, which resulted in slow turnaround times and inconsistencies due to a lack of standardized safety definitions and policies. We have improved the quality of evaluations by introducing policy-aligned rater guidelines to improve human rater accuracy, and are researching additional improvements to better reflect the perspectives of diverse communities. Additionally, automated test set evaluation using LLM-based auto-raters enables efficiency and scaling, while allowing us to direct complex or ambiguous cases to humans for expert rating. </p>; <p>; Beyond testing with adversarial test sets, gathering community insights is vital for continuously discovering “unknown unknowns”. To provide high quality human input that is required to seed the scaled processes, we partner with groups such as the <a href="https://sites.google.com/corp/google.com/earr-external-research-group/home">;Equitable AI Research Round Table</a>; (EARR), and with our internal ethics and analysis teams to ensure that we are representing the diverse communities who use our models. The <a href="https://dynabench.org/tasks/adversarial-nibbler">;Adversarial Nibbler Challenge</a>; engages external users to understand potential harms of <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2305.14384">;unsafe, biased or violent outputs</a>; to end users at scale. Our continuous commitment to community engagement includes gathering feedback from diverse communities and collaborating with the research community, for example during <a href="https://sites.google.com/view/art-of-safety">;The ART of Safety workshop</a>; at the <a href="http://www.ijcnlp-aacl2023.org/">;Asia-Pacific Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics Conference</a>; (IJCNLP-AACL 2023) to address adversarial testing challenges for GenAI. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Rater diversity in safety evaluation</h2>; <p>; Understanding and mitigating GenAI safety risks is both a technical and social challenge. Safety perceptions are intrinsically subjective and influenced by a wide range of intersecting factors. Our in-depth study on demographic influences on safety perceptions explored the <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.11530">;intersectional effects of rater demographics</a>; (eg, race/ethnicity, gender, age) and content characteristics (eg, degree of harm) on safety assessments of GenAI outputs. Traditional approaches largely ignore inherent subjectivity and the systematic disagreements among raters, which can mask important cultural differences. Our <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.05074">;disagreement analysis framework</a>; surfaced a variety of disagreement patterns between raters from diverse backgrounds including also with “ground truth” expert ratings. This paves the way to new approaches for assessing quality of human annotation and model evaluations beyond the simplistic use of gold labels. Our <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.11247">;NeurIPS 2023 publication</a>; introduces the <a href="https://github.com/google-research-datasets/dices-dataset">;DICES</a>; (Diversity In Conversational AI Evaluation for Safety) dataset that facilitates nuanced safety evaluation of LLMs and accounts for variance, ambiguity, and diversity in various cultural contexts. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Summary</h2>; <p>; GenAI has resulted in a technology transformation, opening possibilities for rapid development and customization even without coding. However, it also comes with a risk of generating harmful outputs. Our proactive adversarial testing program identifies and mitigates GenAI risks to ensure inclusive model behavior. Adversarial testing and red teaming are essential components of a Safety strategy, and conducting them in a comprehensive manner is essential. The rapid pace of innovation demands that we constantly challenge ourselves to find “unknown unknowns” in cooperation with our internal partners, diverse user communities, and other industry experts. multimodal understanding to long videos</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;Posted by Isaac Noble, Software Engineer, Google Research, and Anelia Angelova, Research Scientist, Google DeepMind </span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhS9q_iPaPNyYexT4zpSTnERwHJJGcmOemvRjjqD9sNPMwibC-iV5AU2P4J9VrPE_NGFyFz5QLxHpCti9Y-bOPEi9XPCev5YwIpNKPMECDxk1prmksf99tPHgf1uQb7EW3zSmnIMWIFwAjvM7GldhsEtW7eogo1sG1L1nxD8UPIi0fpHR_Iwp8fJTdoUnQB/s1600/mirasol.png" style="display: none;" />; <p>; When building machine learning models for real-life applications, we need to consider inputs from multiple modalities in order to capture various aspects of the world around us. For example, audio, video, and text all provide varied and complementary information about a visual input. However, building multimodal models is challenging due to the heterogeneity of the modalities. Some of the modalities might be well synchronized in time (eg, audio, video) but not aligned with text. Furthermore, the large volume of data in video and audio signals is much larger than that in text, so when combining them in multimodal models, video and audio often cannot be fully consumed and need to be disproportionately compressed. This problem is exacerbated for longer video inputs. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; In “<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.05698">;Mirasol3B: A Multimodal Autoregressive model for time-aligned and contextual modalities</a>;”, we introduce a multimodal <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autoregressive_model">;autoregressive</a>; model (Mirasol3B) for learning across audio, video, and text方式。 The main idea is to decouple the multimodal modeling into separate focused autoregressive models, processing the inputs according to the characteristics of the modalities. Our model consists of an autoregressive component for the time-synchronized modalities (audio and video) and a separate autoregressive component for modalities that are not necessarily time-aligned but are still sequential, eg, text inputs, such as a title or description. Additionally, the time-aligned modalities are partitioned in time where local features can be jointly learned. In this way, audio-video inputs are modeled in time and are allocated comparatively more parameters than prior works. With this approach, we can effortlessly handle much longer videos (eg, 128-512 frames) compared to other multimodal models. At 3B parameters, Mirasol3B is compact compared to prior <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.14198">;Flamingo</a>; (80B) and <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2305.18565">;PaLI-X</a>; (55B) models. Finally, Mirasol3B outperforms the state-of-the-art approaches on <a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/08/efficient-video-text-learning-with.html">;video question answering</a>; (video QA), long video QA, and audio-video-text benchmarks. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgshWPBWMbvzrYbGl-41QRmA5NWiQ4GKMb_nlTl-uKlY6D9TEKosZWbJk_wnllLqyq4GUQT6feI_rLH4rrYVoZHHQET750qT1pxkkiju6mWqG7ddCxLjgpywTb3rnQdDtaUTOeRvnZD0_a2mMauvs7vu6pzboeWcTCt_7bloNMDdZfNyM3Y_7UKcN-7VSqS/s1240/image5.gif " imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="960" data-original-width="1240" src= "https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgshWPBWMbvzrYbGl-41QRmA5NWiQ4GKMb_nlTl-uKlY6D9TEKosZWbJk_wnllLqyq4GUQT6feI_rLH4rrYVoZHHQET750qT1pxkkiju6mWqG7ddCxLjgpywTb3rnQdDtaUTOeRvnZD0_a2mMauvs7vu6pzboeWcTCt_7bloNMDdZfNyM3Y_7UKcN-7VSqS/s16000/image5.gif" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;The Mirasol3B architecture consists of an autoregressive model for the time-aligned modalities (audio and video), which are partitioned in chunks, and a separate autoregressive model for the unaligned context modalities (eg, text). Joint feature learning is conducted by the Combiner, which learns compact but sufficiently informative features, allowing the processing of long video/audio inputs.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Coordinating time-aligned and contextual modalities</h2>; <p>; Video, audio and text are diverse modalities with distinct characteristics. For example, video is a spatio-temporal visual signal with 30–100 frames per second, but due to the large volume of data, typically only 32–64 frames <em>;per video</em>; are consumed by current models. Audio is a one-dimensional temporal signal obtained at much higher frequency than video (eg, at 16 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hertz">;Hz</a>;), whereas text inputs that apply to the whole video, are typically 200–300 word-sequence and serve as a context to the audio-video inputs. To that end, we propose a model consisting of an autoregressive component that fuses and jointly learns the time-aligned signals, which occur at high frequencies and are roughly synchronized, and another autoregressive component for processing non-aligned signals. Learning between the components for the time-aligned and contextual modalities is coordinated via cross-attention mechanisms that allow the two to exchange information while learning in a sequence without having to synchronize them in time. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Time-aligned autoregressive modeling of video and audio</h2>; <p>; Long videos can convey rich information and activities happening in a sequence. However, present models approach video modeling by extracting all the information at once, without sufficient temporal information. To address this, we apply an autoregressive modeling strategy where we condition jointly learned video and audio representations for one time interval on feature representations from previous time intervals. This preserves temporal information. </p>; <p>; The video is first partitioned into smaller video chunks. Each chunk itself can be 4–64 frames. The features corresponding to each chunk are then processed by a learning module, called the Combiner (described below), which generates a joint audio and video feature representation at the current step — this step extracts and compacts the most important information per chunk. Next, we process this joint feature representation with an autoregressive Transformer, which applies attention to the previous feature representation and generates the joint feature representation for the next step. Consequently, the model learns how to represent not only each individual chunk, but also how the chunks relate temporally. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh90Ao2yyoC5TSypNxQzA7F80lQla0f4STDrB6ZdVhINwiiQjOq1WppROFurlUn9-Lq_UUQ9uuQIeRDld-j2NMYl1e5q2Cg2L0zOHXSG0dAkpCSqVe-wEyE8QZtUup7AUazE3sBEyoO2T3RhWSc5Z7o1w0pyqMH0WzTts3vaxUnMNOa61uWXvQ2Wj92evO5/s1259/image1.png " imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="744" data-original-width="1259" src= "https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh90Ao2yyoC5TSypNxQzA7F80lQla0f4STDrB6ZdVhINwiiQjOq1WppROFurlUn9-Lq_UUQ9uuQIeRDld-j2NMYl1e5q2Cg2L0zOHXSG0dAkpCSqVe-wEyE8QZtUup7AUazE3sBEyoO2T3RhWSc5Z7o1w0pyqMH0WzTts3vaxUnMNOa61uWXvQ2Wj92evO5/s16000/image1.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;We use an autoregressive modeling of the audio and video inputs, partitioning them in time and learning joint feature representations, which are then autoregressively learned in sequence.</ td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Modeling long videos with a modality combiner</h2>; < p>; To combine the signals from the video and audio information in each video chunk, we propose a learning module called the Combiner. Video and audio signals are aligned by taking the audio inputs that correspond to a specific video timeframe. We then process video and audio inputs spatio-temporally, extracting information particularly relevant to <em>;changes in the inputs</em>; (for videos we use <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.03229">;sparse video tubes</a>;, and for audio we apply the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spectrogram">;spectrogram</a>; representation, both of which are processed by a <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.11929">;Vision Transformer)</a>;. We concatenate and input these features to the Combiner, which is designed to learn a new feature representation capturing both these inputs. To address the challenge of the large volume of data in video and audio signals, another goal of the Combiner is to reduce the dimensionality of the joint video/audio inputs, which is done by selecting a smaller number of output features to be produced. The Combiner can be implemented simply as a causal Transformer, which processes the inputs in the direction of time, ie, using only inputs of the prior steps or the current one. Alternatively, the Combiner can have a learnable memory, described below. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Combiner styles</h2>; <p>; A simple version of the Combiner adapts a Transformer architecture. More specifically, all audio and video features from the current chunk (and optionally prior chunks) are input to a Transformer and projected to a lower dimensionality, ie, a smaller number of features are selected as the output “combined” features. While Transformers are not typically used in this context, we find it effective for reducing the dimensionality of the input features, by selecting the last <em>;m</em>; outputs of the Transformer, if <em>;m</em>; is the desired output dimension (shown below). Alternatively, the Combiner can have a memory component. For example, we use the <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.09119">;Token Turing Machine</a>; (TTM), which supports a differentiable memory unit, accumulating and compressing features from all previous timesteps 。 Using a fixed memory allows the model to work with a more compact set of features at every step, rather than process all the features from previous steps, which reduces computation. </p>; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="619" data-original-width="1798" src= "https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh0C7t17njiE70O5UrLHjfEHAw5dbAlNvYj7bMxQt_GkxNUdGtnqKyAwpWi7uvE_IGiS-50Q2Qyo4CAzq8uZbkXZ-HzNh-DCh6UNSSIwxUlWSOtihmChwFXD4F3LS73C_1fusf5fQl7TyTQv2L5ycmfSCj36GK3IrN4yaOAjODj09NBmcAMJzV0TZS_0qNI/s16000/image8.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;We use a simple Transformer-based Combiner (<b>;left</b>;) and a Memory Combiner (<b>;right</b>;) , based on the Token Turing Machine (TTM), which uses memory to compress previous history of features.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;" >; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Results</h2>; <p>; We evaluate our approach on several benchmarks, <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/wp- content/uploads/2016/06/cvpr16.msr-vtt.tmei_-1.pdf">;MSRVTT-QA</a>;, <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.02467">;ActivityNet-QA </a>; and <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2105.08276">;NeXT-QA</a>;, for the video QA task, where a text-based question about a video is issued and the model needs to answer. This evaluates the ability of the model to understand both the text-based question and video content, and to form an answer, focusing on only relevant information. Of these benchmarks, the latter two target long video inputs and feature more complex questions. </p>; <p>; We also evaluate our approach in the more challenging open-ended text generation setting, wherein the model generates the answers in an unconstrained fashion as free form text, requiring an exact match to the ground truth answer. While this stricter evaluation counts synonyms as incorrect, it may better reflect a model's ability to generalize. </p>; <p>; Our results indicate improved performance over state-of-the-art approaches for most benchmarks, including all with open-ended generation evaluation — notable considering our model is only 3B parameters, considerably smaller than prior approaches, eg, Flamingo 80B. We used only video and text inputs to be comparable to other work. Importantly, our model can process 512 frames without needing to increase the model parameters, which is crucial for handling longer videos. Finally with the TTM Combiner, we see both better or comparable performance while reducing compute by 18%. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; and <a href="https://epic-kitchens.github.io/epic-sounds/">;EPIC-SOUNDS</a>; are shown below. Since these benchmarks are classification-only, we treat them as an open-ended text generative setting where our model produces the text of the desired class; eg, for the class ID corresponding to the “playing drums” activity, we expect the model to generate the text “playing drums”. In some cases our approach outperforms the prior state of the art by large margins, even though our model outputs the results in the generative open-ended setting. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; We also compare the effects of pre-training. Because standard methods are ill-suited for processing longer video, this experiment is conducted for 32 frames and four chunks only, across all settings for fair comparison. We see that Mirasol3B's improvements are still valid for relatively short videos. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgjD4KZfUgaGluUNoSERSnuaHWMsbyx6AzHrgKrvDB1ZJxpOqNonvOzTI4hGVz4I8KZQT4aDLkQ6rvMjQIHJCY9otQIZHuSeoNK1ciQ2ALE3n1zYzQEvPdwUR_81uEDeD5U9DXDABK8ozbONAHkK0hZFMHS0j6IoumYfmjKI-M9ZHb76F2kHl-6XTPEn2eG/s1200/image4.png" imageanchor ="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="742" data-original-width="1200" src="https ://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgjD4KZfUgaGluUNoSERSnuaHWMsbyx6AzHrgKrvDB1ZJxpOqNonvOzTI4hGVz4I8KZQT4aDLkQ6rvMjQIHJCY9otQIZHuSeoNK1ciQ2ALE3n1zYzQEvPdwUR_81uEDeD5U9DXDABK8ozbONAHkK0hZFMHS0j6IoumYfmjKI-M9ZHb76F2kHl-6XTPEn2eG/s16000/image4.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr -caption" style="text-align: center;">;Ablation experiments comparing the main components of our model. Using the Combiner, the autoregressive modeling, and pre-training all improve performance.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Conclusion </h2>; <p>; We present a multimodal autoregressive model that addresses the challenges associated with the heterogeneity of multimodal data by coordinating the learning between time-aligned and time-unaligned modalities. Time-aligned modalities are further processed autoregressively in time with a Combiner, controlling the sequence length and producing powerful representations. We demonstrate that a relatively small model can successfully represent long video and effectively combine with other modalities. We outperform the state-of-the-art approaches (including some much bigger models) on video- and audio-video question answering. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Acknowledgements</h2>; <p>; <em>;This research is co-authored by AJ Piergiovanni, Isaac Noble, Dahun Kim, Michael Ryoo, Victor Gomes, and Anelia Angelova. style="display: none;" />; <p>; As consumer technologies like <a href="https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/healthcare-life-sciences/google-cloud-fitbit-haga-collaborate-on-pilot-heart-study">;fitness trackers</a>; and <a href="https://blog.google/products/pixel/health-ai-better-sleep/">;mobile phones</a>; become more widely used for health-related data collection, so does the opportunity to leverage these data pathways to study and advance our understanding of medical conditions. We have <a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/11/responsible-ai-at-google-research.html">;previously</a>; touched upon how our work explores the use of this technology within the context of chronic diseases, in particular multiple sclerosis (MS). This effort leverages the <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies">;FDA MyStudies platform</a>;, an open-source platform used to create clinical study apps, that makes it easier for anyone to run their own studies and collect good quality healthcare data, in a trusted and safe way. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; Today, we describe the setup that we developed by expanding the FDA MyStudies platform and demonstrate how it can be used to set up a digital health study. We also present our exploratory research study created through this platform, called MS Signals, which consists of a symptom tracking app for MS patients. The goal for this app is twofold: 1) to ensure that the enhancements to the FDA MyStudies platform made for a more streamlined study creation experience; and 2) to understand how new data collection mechanisms can be used to revolutionize patients' chronic disease management and tracking. We have <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies-flutter">;open sourced</a>; our extension to the FDA MyStudies platform under the <a href="https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0">;Apache 2.0 license</a>; to provide a resource for the community to build their own studies. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Extending the FDA MyStudies platform</h2>; <p>; The original FDA MyStudies platform allowed people to configure their own study apps, manage participants, and create separate iOS and Android apps. To simplify the study creation process and ensure increased study engagement, we made a number of accessibility changes. Some of the main improvements include: cross-platform (iOS and Android) app generation through the use of <a href="https://flutter.dev/">;Flutter</a>;, an open source framework by Google for building multi-platform applications from a single codebase; a simplified setup, so that users can prototype their study quickly (under a day in most cases); and, most importantly, an emphasis on accessibility so that diverse patient's voices are heard. The accessibility enhancements include changes to the underlying features of the platform and to the particular study design of the MS Signals study app. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;Multi-platform support with rapid prototyping</h3>; <p>; We decided on the use of Flutter as it would be a single point that would generate both iOS and Android apps in one go, reducing the work required to support multiple platforms. Flutter also provides <a href="https://docs.flutter.dev/tools/hot-reload">;hot-reloading</a>;, which allows developers to build & preview features quickly. The design-system in the app takes advantage of this feature to provide a central point from which the branding & theme of the app can be changed to match the tone of a new study and previewed instantly. The demo environment in the app also utilizes this feature to allow developers to mock and preview questionnaires locally on their machines. In our experience this has been a huge time-saver in A/B testing the UX and the format and wording of questions live with clinicians. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;System accessibility enhancements</h3>; <p>; To improve the accessibility of the platform for more users, we made several usability enhancements: </p>; <ol>; <li>;Light & dark theme support</li>; <li>;Bold text & variable font-sizes</li>; <li>;High-contrast mode</li>; <li>;Improving user awareness of accessibility settings</li>; </ol>; <p>; Extended exposure to bright light themes can strain the eyes, so supporting dark theme features was necessary to make it easier to use the study app frequently. Some small or light text-elements are illegible to users with vision impairments, so we added 1) bold-text and support for larger font-sizes and 2) high-contrast color-schemes. To ensure that accessibility settings are easy to find, we placed an introductory one-time screen that was presented during the app's first launch, which would directly take users to their system accessibility settings. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;Study accessibility enhancements</h3>; <p>; To make the study itself easier to interact with and reduce cognitive overload, we made the following changes: </p>; <ol>; <li>;Clarified the onboarding process</li>; <li>;Improved design for questionnaires</li>; </ol>; <p>; First, we clarified the on-boarding process by presenting users with a list of required steps when they first open the app in order to reduce confusion and participant drop-off. </p>; <p>; The original questionnaire design in the app presented each question in a card format, which utilizes part of the screen for shadows and depth effects of the card. In many situations, this is a pleasant aesthetic, but in apps where accessibility is priority, these visual elements restrict the space available on the screen. Thus, when more accessible, larger font-sizes are used there are more frequent word breaks, which reduces readability. We fixed this simply by removing the card design elements and instead using the entire screen, allowing for better visuals with larger font-sizes. </p>; <br />; <h2>;The MS Signals prototype study</h2>; <p>; To test the usability of these changes, we used our redesigned platform to create a prototype study app called MS Signals, which uses surveys to gather information about a participant's MS-related symptoms. </p>;
